alert.note: Alert for Clarendon (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 4:14AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Clarendon County through 500 AM EDT... At 413 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Summerton, or 7 miles southwest of Manning, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manning, Summerton and Alcolu. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 109 and 126. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
